createAnnotation

public static <T extends org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaElement> IAnnotation<T> createAnnotation(java.lang.String annotationQName,
                                                                                            java.util.Set<IParamValuePair> paramValuePairs,
                                                                                            T appliedElement)
Creates complex Annotation, e.g. Annotation of kind \@WebService(param1="value1", param2="value2").

Parameters:
annotationQName -
paramValuePairs -
Returns:
Instantiated Annotation of type IComplexAnnotation.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - in case annotationQName or paramValuePairs are null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case annotationQName is empty String.

createAnnotation

public static IAnnotation<? extends org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaElement> createAnnotation(java.lang.String annotationQName,
                                                                                        org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaElement appliedElement,
                                                                                        java.util.Set<IParamValuePair> paramValuePairs)
Creates IAnnotation instance that references appliedElement java element

Parameters:
annotationQName - the annotation name
appliedElement - the java element that this annotation is applied on
paramValuePairs - the annotation attributes
Returns:
IAnnotation instance
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - in case some of params is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case annotationQName is empty string

removeAnnotationsFromJavaElement

public static void removeAnnotationsFromJavaElement(org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaElement javaElement)
                                             throws AnnotationGeneratorException
Removes all Annotations from javaElement.

Parameters:
javaElement -
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if javaElement is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case javaElement is not of the correct type. Supported types are: Itype, IMethod, IField, ITypeParameter
AnnotationGeneratorException

removeAnnotations

                                     java.util.Set<java.lang.String> annotations)
                              throws AnnotationGeneratorException
Removes Annotations with names contained in annotations from javaElement and its children, if such exist.

Parameters:
javaElement -
annotations -
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if javaElement or annotations is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case javaElement is not of the correct type. Supported types are: Itype, IMethod, IField, ITypeParameter
